dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: ...just proves what I’ve been saying, uh, this was always a house of cards, right? I mean, Rawlinson, the guy behind the Model S, just, what, completely fell apart.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: ...just proves what I've been saying, uh, this was always a house of cards, right? I mean, Rawlinson, the guy behind the Model S, just, what, completely fell apart.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The provided article does not contain information about Rawlinson or Lucid Motors falling apart. It states the company plans to start building its first model next year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: No, see, that’s where you’re completely missing the point, like, it's not about Rawlinson failing. This is about, um, the sheer volatility of the EV market itself.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, see, that's where you're completely missing the point, like, it's not about Rawlinson failing. This is about, um, the sheer volatility of the E V market itself.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Volatility? Peter, they literally found Hochholdinger buying a private island with company funds! A private island! That’s not volatility, that’s, uh, outright fraud!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Volatility? Peter, they literally found Hochholdinger buying a private island with company funds! A private island! That's not volatility, that's, uh, outright fraud!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Silicon Valley-based Lucid said that Peter Hochholdinger has joined the company as vice president of manufacturing.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: But is it just Hochholdinger? Or is this a symptom of an industry pushing, like, completely unrealistic promises? A 2000-mile range? Five hundred grand?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But is it just Hochholdinger? Or is this a symptom of an industry pushing, like, completely unrealistic promises? A two thousand-mile range? Five hundred grand?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Air, which Lucid has been developing for more than three years, is to be even more premium than Teslas Model S, priced from over $100,000.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: So Rawlinson was just an innocent bystander then? The CEO? Who, by the way, was ousted after an internal investigation into fraudulent financial practices himself, remember?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So Rawlinson was just an innocent bystander then? The C E O? Who, by the way, was ousted after an internal investigation into fraudulent financial practices himself, remember?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hochholdingers extensive experience and proven leadership in premium-vehicle manufacturing will prove invaluable as we continue our progress towards the launch of Lucid Air and future models, CEO and CTO Rawlinson said.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Ousted or, um, made a scapegoat? Like, the Saudi investors pulled out, sure, but who's to say they weren't part of a bigger play? With the shady online gaming money, it just feels... engineered.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ousted or, um, made a scapegoat? Like, the Saudi investors pulled out, sure, but who's to say they weren't part of a bigger play? With the shady online gaming money, it just feels... engineered.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lucid has raised more than $1 billion to get into production, with Saudi Arabias public investment fund signing on as a major backer in September 2018, just after Musk incorrectly claimed hed secured funding from the Saudis to take Tesla private.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Engineered? No, what's engineered is trying to paint this as anything other than a spectacular, uh, failure of management and, frankly, ethics. They had five billion dollars. Five billion from some really questionable sources, too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Engineered? No, what's engineered is trying to paint this as anything other than a spectacular, uh, failure of management and, frankly, ethics. They had five billion dollars. Five billion from some really questionable sources, too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lucid has raised more than $1 billion to get into production, with Saudi Arabias public investment fund signing on as a major backer in September 2018...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: An alleged Chinese state-backed fund? And then the factory gets sold to crypto miners? That just screams, like, opportunism, not outright collapse from within.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: An alleged Chinese state-backed fund? And then the factory gets sold to crypto miners? That just screams, like, opportunism, not outright collapse from within.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lucids factory is to be built in Casa Grande, Arizona, midway between Phoenix and Tucson, and, initially, will be relatively small scale, with capacity to produce just 20,000 units a year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: It screams collapse and a fire sale! And it just solidifies Tesla's position, doesn't it? While everyone else is, uh, folding, Tesla's still there.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It screams collapse and a fire sale! And it just solidifies Tesla's position, doesn't it? While everyone else is, uh, folding, Tesla's still there.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Tesla? Oh, come on, you’re conveniently forgetting Musk was just on an internet forum trying to, um, offload a percentage of their self-driving tech to some anonymous buyer.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Tesla? Oh, come on, you're conveniently forgetting Musk was just on an internet forum trying to, um, offload a percentage of their self-driving tech to some anonymous buyer.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The article does not mention Elon Musk attempting to sell self-driving technology on an internet forum. It does state that a key member of the Autopilot team left for another company.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: That's just Musk being Musk, doing business! That's not the same as the CEO of a company getting caught with his hand in the cookie jar and the whole thing going belly up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's just Musk being Musk, doing business! That's not the same as the C E O of a company getting caught with his hand in the cookie jar and the whole thing going belly up.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: It's a red flag! A big one! Like, if things were so great, why are they, uh, selling off key assets in such a weird way?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's a red flag! A big one! Like, if things were so great, why are they, uh, selling off key assets in such a weird way?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Because he's an entrepreneur, he's innovative! Unlike Lucid, which was a dream built on, um, outright deception. Half a million dollars for a car that doesn't even exist anymore!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Because he's an entrepreneur, he's innovative! Unlike Lucid, which was a dream built on, um, outright deception. Half a million dollars for a car that doesn't even exist anymore!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Air, which Lucid has been developing for more than three years, is to be even more premium than Teslas Model S, priced from over $100,000.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: And half a million for a car from a company that’s now selling its self-driving tech on a message board. I'm just saying, it’s not as black and white as 'Lucid bad, Tesla good'.
